meanings.definition: Having the most wrinkles or shriveled appearance, resembling a prune.
meanings.sent1: The old elephant had the pruniest skin in the entire jungle.
meanings.sent2: The raisins were the pruniest fruits in the basket.
meanings.sent3: The pruniest puppy in the litter was actually the cutest.
meanings.sent4: Her hands felt like the pruniest leaves in autumn.
meanings.sent5: The pruniest apple in the orchard was left untouched by the birds.

meanings.definition: To become wrinkled or shriveled, as if resembling a prune.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the grapes out in the sun caused them to pruniest quickly.
meanings.sent2: If you stay in the bath too long, your fingers will pruniest.
meanings.sent3: The laundry was forgotten in the dryer and prunied all night.
meanings.sent4: The flowers prunied in the heat, wilting under the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: His skin prunied after swimming for hours in the pool.
